results.title: A Killer on the Loose Leaves an Idaho College Town Shaken
results.abstract: A third of the students living in the dorms at the University of Idaho have not returned after the Thanksgiving break, as residents worry about their safety.

media.caption: A moment of silence during a vigil at the University of Idaho on Wednesday.
media.copyright: Rajah Bose for The New York Times

results.byline: By Maya King, Clyde McGrady and Jazmine Ulloa
results.title: In Georgia, a Heated Senate Race Stirs Mixed Emotions in Black Voters
results.abstract: The contest might have been a showcase of Black political power in the Deep South. But many Black voters say Herschel Walker’s turbulent campaign has marred the moment.

media.caption: Georgia has never had two Black major-party nominees compete for the Senate. The race has prompted interest and sensitive debates among Black voters.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.title: My Building Has Replaced Our Keys With an App. Is That Legal?

results.title: FedEx Driver Charged in Kidnapping and Killing of Girl, 7, Officials Say
results.abstract: About 200 people in Paradise, Texas, searched for Athena Strand, who was taken near her home on Wednesday and found dead on Friday, the authorities said.

media.caption: The body of 7-year-old Athena Strand of Paradise, Texas, was found on Friday, officials said.

results.adx_keywords: Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;Police;Muslim Veiling;Amini, Mahsa (2000-22);Iran
results.byline: By Vivian Yee and Farnaz Fassihi
results.title: Iran Has Abolished Morality Police, an Official Suggests, After Months of Protests
results.abstract: The move, which the government did not confirm, might be a concession to the protest movement that erupted after the death of a young woman in the custody of the morality police.

media.caption: Demonstrators in Tehran in October. The protests ignited by the death of Mahsa Amini have grown to encompass the entire range of discontents with Iran’s rulers.

results.title: Ukraine Calls for Evacuations From a Russian-Controlled Area, Signaling a New Offensive
results.abstract: A Ukrainian official urged civilians to leave the eastern bank of the Dnipro River, across from the city of Kherson, warning of the “possible intensification of hostilities” there.

media.caption: Pro-Ukrainian billboards on Friday in Kherson, a strategic southern city that Ukrainian forces recently recaptured. Weeks earlier, posters there had pro-Russian messages.

results.byline: By Jeffrey Gettleman and Finbarr O’Reilly
results.title: He Returned a Dazed Soldier to the Russians. Ukraine Calls It Treason.
results.abstract: No one knew what to do with a lost Russian pilot who suddenly appeared in the occupied city of Kherson. The case has revealed the blurred line between pragmatism in a war zone and collaboration with the enemy.

results.title: Owner Parts With Rare Emerald From 1622 Shipwreck to Help Ukraine
results.abstract: The gem, recovered from the Nuestra Señora de Atocha, ended up in the possession of the chicken magnate Frank Perdue. His widow, Mitzi Perdue, is auctioning it to support humanitarian efforts in Ukraine.

media.caption: Mitzi Perdue was given a ring, bearing an emerald from the 1622 wreck of the Nuestra Señora de Atocha, from Frank Perdue in 1988, when he proposed. It will be auctioned at Sotheby’s in New York on Dec. 7.

results.title: A Straw Leads to the Arrest of a Man Suspected in Bank Robberies, Officials Say
results.abstract: DNA found on the straw used for a Red Bull drink at a casino led to the arrest of a man who is being investigated in more than a dozen robberies in four states, prosecutors said.

media.caption: In each of the robberies, the suspect wore similar clothing and exhibited a unique tendency to obscure his right hand, according to court records.
